content.description: Before it was cleaned this looked like it would be a splitter hand crack. Unfortunately in some ways, in the upper half it narrows right down to nothing in the back. This does make it a more formidable challenge however and that's always fun. Climb the easy first half to a stance then navigate the interesting flaired upper half taking care in gear placement as it is pretty particular and tricky to protect in the crux.
content.protection: trad gear from micro to hands
content.location: The Crack that splits the split slab top to bottom.

content.description: Climb up below the first bolt then traverse left below the overlap. Clip a second bolt and manage a tricky pull onto the slab. Move up and left to gain a point of rock that feels great after all that slab friction. Stand on the point and get ready for round two. A mixed protection puzzle session trying to work your way up the slab/chimney. Romp up and right to a two bolt anchor shared with Thunder Buddies.
content.protection: 4 bolts and some gear to a two bolt anchor.
content.location: The left side of the left most slab, split by a vertical crack.

content.description: Only a couple of routes so far but both are delightful and challenging. The is a little more potential but just like with the existing routes, developing on the slablands takes extra elbow grease.
